high_performers.body:
As promised I'm here to provide you with a quote Jonathan. 

Price changes depending on the frequency you pay employees - these are our weekly plans:
Select Plan - Base fee $43.50 + $3.10/employee 
Pro Plan - $91 + $3.85
Enterprise plan - $131 + $5.15

To give you a 100% accurate quote please reply with the amount of employees you have, the frequency you'd like to pay them, and a price you'd like me to beat.

Each tier gives you additional free services such as free HR Handbook Creation, Automated QuickBooks Integrations, $150 labor law posters for free, filing taxes for you, and more. 

Let me know your honest opinion, I'm happy to work with you to earn your business.

high_performers.name: Partha Sarathi Samal
high_performers.headline: Quality Engineering Leader | Author | Inventor | Keynote Speaker |9x Hackathon Winner| AI/ML Evangelist |
high_performers.body:
Hi Partha,

I noticed that you are a Quality Engineering Manager at UST and it looks like you have a hand in software testing.

At mabl our platform automates API, end-to-end, and UI testing. 
We have been able to cut down maintenance time by 85%, increase test creation by 300%, and even have an AI auto healing function for broken tests.
Our mission is to help you spend less time on time consuming tasks like those so you can spend more time doing the important stuff.

Now that 2022 is starting, what are your initiatives to improve test automation in the new year?

Best,
Rob

high_performers.name: Sarat Ramineni
high_performers.headline: Director of Quality Engineering | 1.7x ROI on Automation | Enterprise QA Strategy & DevOps | 2x Release Velocity via Shift-Left & CI/CD
high_performers.body:
Hi Sarat,

A lot of the Software Quality Director's I’ve met with this year have said that their QA teams has a lot of software testing that needs to be completed in time for their release deadlines.
The problem is that their QA teams can’t finish testing in time so they end up having to push release dates or push out a product that has errors in the code. This has caused negative customer experiences in the past and has pushed customers away from using their applications.

Mabl was able to solve this problem for companies like Charles Schwab, Intuit, and Chewy so was hoping to hear if you’re experiencing any challenges with your teams to see if we can help you?

Best,
Rob

high_performers.name: Gary Horne
high_performers.headline: Technical Support Manager
high_performers.body:
Hi Gary,  
I noticed that you are a QA Manager at Sony and oversee software testing within an Agile team. 
 
Mabl is a low code automation platform and could be of use to you because it has been able to improve release velocity and decrease bugs sent to production since it cuts down the time of maintenance by 85%, increases test execution speed by 300%, and auto heals broken tests automatically. Leaving much more time for you or your team to focus on important tasks. 
 
Companies like JetBlue, ADP, and Charles Shwab have all seen a major increase in testing efficiency because of Mabl’s capabilities. 
 
Enough about me though, what is your focus within testing for your team?
 
Best, 
Rob
